intro: Lecanorchis albida, commonly known as the white lecanorchis, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. This terrestrial orchid typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its flowers are small and pale yellow, with a distinctive white lip that is prominent in its morphology. The plant has a short rhizome and produces a single spike of flowers, which bloom during the wet season. It is characterized by its simple, linear leaves and is often found in association with specific mycorrhizal fungi.
